messages.content: What is SDXL Prompt Styler in ComfyUI?

SDXL Prompt Styler is a custom node in ComfyUI that allows users to style prompts based on predefined templates stored in multiple JSON files. It specifically replaces a {prompt} placeholder in the 'prompt' field of each template with provided positive text.
How does SDXL Prompt Styler handle negative prompts?

If negative text is provided, SDXL Prompt Styler combines it with the 'negative_prompt' field from the template. If no negative text is supplied, it defaults to using the 'negative_prompt' from the JSON template.
What new feature was added to SDXL Prompt Styler Advanced in the commit dated 2024-01-26?
In the commit dated 2024-01-26, a new option was added to SDXL Prompt Styler Advanced to copy the positive G prompt tokens to L, removing duplicates.
What update was made to SDXL Prompt Styler in the commit dated 2024-01-19?
In the commit dated 2024-01-19, toggles were added to SDXL Prompt Styler to disable styling for positive, negative, or both sentiments (bypass mode).
What important update was made in the commit dated 2023-08-11 regarding the file structure and naming convention for style JSONs?

In the commit dated 2023-08-11, the file structure and naming convention for style JSONs were modified. Users were advised to back up their custom styles, create a new JSON file in the styles directory, move their custom styles into this new file, ensure unique style names, and manage included JSON files.
How can users install SDXL Prompt Styler nodes in ComfyUI?

To install SDXL Prompt Styler nodes, users need to open a terminal, navigate to the 'ComfyUI/custom_nodes/' directory, run the command 'git clone https://github.com/twri/sdxl_prompt_styler.git', and restart ComfyUI.
What are the inputs and outputs of SDXL Prompt Styler?

The inputs of SDXL Prompt Styler are 'text_positive' (text for the positive base prompt), 'text_negative' (text for the negative base prompt), and 'log_prompt' (print inputs and outputs to stdout). The outputs are 'text_positive' (combined prompt with style for positive prompt) and 'text_negative' (combined prompt with style for negative prompt).
